Thanks Bhavik!

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

### PR summary [9e57acb865](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14425/commits/9e57acb865345bc1e7c86f8b166c0f32b2219476)

|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>
I'd prefer to block this on #14431, to motivate review there once I finish up in an hour or so

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9814524526/job/27102272300)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9814524526/job/27102272624)
lgtm but I wrote it, so someone else should review too.

Nevermind, I can't actually make `decreasingInduction'` work with `induction` after all, it's not an induction principle in the usual sense because the inductive step depends on the original value.

bors merge

bors merge
This bugged me, so I've made a start on https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14431
Nerdsniping Eric is the best kind of nerdsnipe üòù
This was the best possible outcome of this golf :D
